page.title: 04ECOLOGY,CLIMATE
page.content: CLIMATE The climate of the area is typical of the uplands of south and mid-Wales, being cool,wet,windy and cloudy at all seasons. There are no long-continued records for any meteorological stat- ions within the area but there is an important set of temperature records for two mountain sites. These were collected by Professor J.Oliver,form- erly of the University College of Swansea for the 26 months from Oct. 1958 through April 1961. This work is described in the TRANS. INSTITUTE OF BRITISH GEOGRAPHERS,35,1964. The two stations were located at:- 1)The summit of Fan Frynych(629metres) 2)Pont Blaen-cwm ddu (373 metres) on the southern slopes of Fan Frynych.
